name: Version 6.0.0
body: Version 6.0.0 breaks compatibility by removing the old style TableauRestApiConnection classes. Now only TableauServerRest remains, with all examples and the README updated. There are a few changes to method signatures to achieve future-proofing, particularly create_site and update_site which now have an options_dict argument to allow putting any of the multitude of site configuration options, and all the methods which had arguments for specific filters, where the checks have been removed and you just pass a List of any UrlFilter objects you want. This is the final release by the original author, and this GitHub account will be maintained by the wider Tableau Embedded Presales Team after this release.

name: Version 5.2.1
body: Fixes a crucial bug in the Permissions updating code, where existing permissions were not being deleted when there was a different set of permissions to send. Should also speed up the other case, which was situations where no changes were necessary.

name: Version 5.2.0 - Introducing RestTokensManager class
body: Along with some bugfixes and updates to examples, 5.2.0 adds the RestTokensManager class to the base distribution. There is an example of it being used called limited_rest_api_wrapping_tableau_rest_api.py which shows in action. README needs to be updated to reflect its full functionality. This is based on best practice implementation of a single process web application like Django needing to request things like Workbooks for individual users.

name: Version 5.1.3 - bug in workbook publish
body: The baseline publish_workbook method had a typo that was breaking it. Later overrides of that method were correct. Now all versions should work.

name: Version 5.1.1 - Bugfixes to 5.1.0
body: A few bugfixes here and there. Thanks to DataBoss-Joe for some key commits, very excited to have people participating in the project.

name: Version 5.1.0 - Improved logging and other good fixes
body: Version 5.1.0 rewrites the Logger class to provide consistent timestamps and a modular set of options for what you want to see. It also corrects many issues in the PublishedContent classes that resulted from some of the import rules/logic around type declarations.

name: v.5.0.6 - This one should work!
body: More issues with relative imports hopefully corrected completely.

name: Version 5.0.4
body: Updated UrlFilters to handle datedate.datetime objects, updates to README and new examples with better tableau_documents instructions.

name: Version 5.0.3
body: Fixed the dbname and schema properties of TableauConnection to allow for setting both properties separately on those datasources that have them both.

name: Version 5.0.2 - Just like version 5.0.0, but working!
body: No one has ever said Python packaging was easy! Please use 5.0.2, as it fixes some packaging issues that were hard to catch in local testing.

name: Version 5.0.0 -- All Python 3.6, all improved
body:
Version 5.0.0 is a near complete rewrite into native Python 3.6, including type hinting for everything, all API versions up to Tableau Server 2019.4 supported, and much better modeling of the document objects in tableau_documents. The biggest change is the introduction of the TableauServerRest classes, which have much better organization for easier code-completion in your IDE.

 Please see the README and the newly updated examples for what everything looks like. Hopefully there aren't too many issues, but we'll be iterating quickly to fix them as they arise.

name: Version 4.9.9 - Final 4 series, Python 2.7 release
body: This is the last Python 2.7 release. It includes a python_requires statement in setup.py which should allow for fallback to this one

name: Version 4.9.7
body: Bugfix to 4.9.6

name: Version 4.9.6
body: Fixed the error handling in the JSON requests object

name: Version 4.9.3
body: Added swap_token() method to TableauRestApiConnection class for use with a wrapped RESTful API service.

name: Version 4.9.2
body: Minor fixes/updates to TableauBase class and a new example with a TableauConnectionsManager class for use when wrapping tableau_tools in another REST API.

name: Version 4.9.1
body: Quick bugfix for the file_replacement_map parameter added to save_file. Please upgrade to this branch if using 4.9.0

name: Version 4.9.0
body: Fully implemented API Version 3.3 (2019.1) including the Flow methods for Prep Conductor. Also added the View hiding at Publish Time from 3.2 which was missed the first time around. Also a new method for swapping in static Data Files using Tableau Documents -- swap in an updated CSV, XLS, or Hyper file to an existing TDSX / TWBX then publish that updated version.

name: version 4.8.3
body: Fields were never implemented from REST API 2.5+  on Views on Site methods. Implemented now.

name: version 4.8.2
body: 4.8.0 was implementation of JSON request methods for plural querying methods. .1 and .2 are quick bug fix / additions.

name: Version 4.7.2
body: Small bugfix on the published data source detection

name: Version 4.7.1
body: Quick fix change to 4.7.0

name: Version 4.7.0
body: This release starts adding a direct_xml_request optional parameter to add and update requests to allow for full replication of one site to another. The full set of commands has not been updated yet, so expect follow on releases.

name: Version 4.6.5
body: Adds in the 3.2 API class into the init.py and made the add_extract method aware of the 2018 and later releases.

name: Version 4.6.3
body: Implemented includeExtract parameter on workbook and datasource download calls

name: Version 4.6.2
body: Version 4..6.2 implements fixes for a host of issues reported here on GitHub.

name: Version 4.6.1
body: Implements the 2018.3 API 3.2 as well as improves the TableauColumns code and the related documentation for how to change captions (useful for translating data sources).

name: Version 4.6.0
body: Version 4.6.0 implements fixes to quite a few reported issues. It also updates many of the parameter names from "p_name_or_luid" to "proj_name_or_luid" for naming consistency which could cause a break if you have named optional parameters. Some lookup commands now use a faster algorithm to find matches.

name: Version 4.5.3
body: A few bug fixes and added a method for updating datasource table names for sources like Oracle and Teradata where the schema/dbname is recorded as part of the table identifier.

name: Version 4.5.2
body: Implemented 2018.2 REST API and added PDF export endpoint filters, along with bug fixes for parameters.

name: Version 4.5.1
body: version 4.5.1 brings an improved README in Markdown, courtesy of Tableau's Mike Morrow, and a very thorough example of how to replicate over workbooks connected to published data sources from one site to another in the template_publish_sample.py file. Plus other great fixes

name: Version 4.5.0
body: Version 4.5.0 brings API 3.0 compatibility (2018.1) as well as some improvements deep in the RestXmlRequest class, so that requests all go along a single session instead of creating new connections over and over.

name: Version 4.4.1
body: Quick release dropping the destructor function of TableauFile in the hopes to fix some issues people are seeing. A few other fixes in Parameters and other aspects, but there will be more coming on that front soon

name: Version 4.4.0
body: Version 4.4.0 adds fully documented methods for modifying existing table relations, setting and creating Tableau Parameters, and can now use Extract API 2.0 to generate Hyper extracts when adding an extract to a 10.5 and above data source.

name: Version 4.3.15
body: 4.3.15 fixes some basic issues with creating a data source from scratch. README sectio 2.10 has been updated to show the initial syntax that should work

name: Version 4.3.14
body: Fixes for datasources and an improvement to InheritedProjectPermissions

name: v.4.3.13
body: Some people skip 13 for bad luck, I skipped 12. This has a lot of fixes for opening and saving complex TDEs, as well as updates for InheritedProjectPermissions in REST API 2.8. Definitely upgrade.

name: Verison 4.3.11
body: This is a small bug-fix release, but reflects the first actual "Release" made using Git. From here on out, specific releases will be made in GitHub, and those will be in sync with the releases on PyPi. The main branch itself may actually be ahead with minor fixes.
